representative_quote: Invest in developer experience - good CI/CD, fast builds, helpful error messages compound.
I design with accessibility in mind from the start.
My job is to figure out what we should build why and when.

biggest_pain_point: Poor data quality requiring extensive cleaning
top_goal: Spend more time on modelling less on cleaning
representative_quote: I spend 60% of my time on data cleaning. The actual modelling is the easy part.
When I'm on call at 2 AM I don't want to reverse-engineer clever automation.
Love the hot reload - best developer experience in years.
Spent days debugging issues caused by incorrect docs.
Test automation is decent but test data management is still painful.
Security scanning caught several vulnerabilities before production.
Versioning is confusing - hard to maintain docs for multiple versions.
Reporting features don't give me the insights I need.
Cross-platform build system reduced release time from days to hours.
Alert correlation has reduced our MTTR significantly.
Query optimisation suggestions are often wrong.
Can finally trace issues from frontend to database.
Diagrams export poorly - client presentations need manual cleanup.
Self-service has reduced tickets by 60%.
Had to integrate external tools for proper model versioning.
Multi-team coordination still needs work.
Managing AWS and Azure from one place has been game-changing.
